title: sampledatasets: A collection of Sample DataSets
text: sampledatasets package provides diverse collection sample datasets, covering various fields automotive performance safety, historical demographics, socioeconomic indicators, recreational data. package serves valuable resource researchers analysts seeking perform analyses derive insights classic datasets R.

title: sampledatasets: A collection of Sample DataSets
text: dataset includes suffix indicating format help users identify data type easily. suffixes include: df: standard data frame. tbl: tibble data frame.

title: sampledatasets: A collection of Sample DataSets
text: sampledatasets package includes following datasets: mtcars_df: data frame containing motor trend car data, including miles per gallon, horsepower, weight. swiss_df: data frame Swiss socioeconomic data, including fertility rates education levels. cars_df: data frame car speed stopping distances. arbuthnot_tbl: tibble historical birth records year, including counts boys girls. cards_tbl: tibble representing standard 52-card deck, including values, suits, colors. datasets sampledatasets retain original structure content, ensuring integrity reliability analyses.

title: sampledatasets: A collection of Sample DataSets
text: demonstrate datasets, visualization examples using ggplot2 package. Visualization Miles Per Gallon Cars  Distribution Fertility Rates Swiss Data
code: # Example: Scatter plot of miles per gallon vs weight mtcars_df %>%   ggplot(aes(x = wt, y = mpg, color = cyl)) +   geom_point(alpha = 0.7) +   labs(     title = "Miles Per Gallon vs Weight",     x = "Weight (1000 lbs)",     y = "Miles per Gallon",     color = "Cylinders"   ) +   theme_minimal() # Example: Histogram of fertility rates swiss_df %>%   ggplot(aes(x = Fertility)) +   geom_histogram(binwidth = 5, fill = "blue", color = "black", alpha = 0.7) +   labs(     title = "Distribution of Fertility Rates in Switzerland",     x = "Fertility Rate",     y = "Count"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: sampledatasets: A collection of Sample DataSets
text: sampledatasets package provides extensive collection datasets useful wide range analyses. suffixes dataset names make easy identify type data, ensuring efficient analysis process.

title: A Collection of Sample Datasets
text: sampledatasets package provides collection sample datasets various fields automotive performance, safety data, historical demographics, socioeconomic indicators, recreational data. datasets serve resource researchers analysts seeking perform analyses derive insights classic data sets R.

title: A Collection of Sample Datasets
text: sampledatasets package includes datasets various domains, sourced existing datasets R clearly identified suffixes denote structure either data frame (_df) tibble (_tbl). clear naming convention helps users quickly identify structure dataset.

title: A Collection of Sample Datasets
text: mtcars_df: data frame version classic mtcars dataset, containing automotive performance specifications. swiss_df: data frame version classic swiss dataset, focused socio-economic indicators Switzerland. cars_df: data frame version cars dataset, contains speed stopping distance data cars. arbuthnot_tbl: tibble version arbuthnot dataset, historical birth data John Arbuthnot’s 1710 study. cards_tbl: tibble version cards dataset, containing data playing cards.

title: A Collection of Sample Datasets
text: can install sampledatasets package CRAN using following command:

title: A Collection of Sample Datasets
text: use datasets provided sampledatasets package, simply load package call desired dataset using data() function.

title: A Collection of Sample Datasets
text: dataset structured either **data frame (_df)** **tibble (_tbl)**, indicated suffix names. can use just like dataset R analysis, visualizations, statistical modeling.
code: # Load the sampledatasets package library(sampledatasets)  # Load a dataset data("mtcars_df")  # View the first few rows of the dataset head(mtcars_df)  # Load another dataset data("arbuthnot_tbl")  # View the dataset structure str(arbuthnot_tbl)

what: Male and female births in London — arbuthnot_tbl
title: Male and female births in London — arbuthnot_tbl
text: `arbuthnot_tbl` dataset contains historical baptism records collected John Arbuthnot. includes data number boys girls baptized year 1629 1710 London. dataset historically significant one earliest applications statistical analysis human populations. dataset name suffixed `_tbl` indicate tibble, ensuring clarity within `sampledatasets` package.

title: Male and female births in London — arbuthnot_tbl
Male and female births in London — arbuthnot_tbl
text: tibble 82 observations 3 variables: year Year record (integer). boys Number boys baptized (integer). girls Number girls baptized (integer).

title: Male and female births in London — arbuthnot_tbl
text: Arbuthnot, J. (1710). *argument Divine Providence, taken constant regularity observed births sexes*.

what: Standard Deck of Playing Cards — cards_tbl
title: Standard Deck of Playing Cards — cards_tbl
text: `cards_tbl` dataset represents standard deck 52 playing cards. includes information value, color, suit, whether card face card. dataset name suffixed `_tbl` indicate tibble, ensuring clarity within `sampledatasets` package.

title: Standard Deck of Playing Cards — cards_tbl
Standard Deck of Playing Cards — cards_tbl
text: tibble 52 observations 4 variables: value Card value (factor 13 levels: "2" "10", "Jack", "Queen", "King", "Ace"). color Card color (factor 2 levels: "black", "red"). suit Card suit (factor 4 levels: "Clubs", "Diamonds", "Hearts", "Spades"). face Logical indicator (TRUE card face card, FALSE otherwise).

title: Standard Deck of Playing Cards — cards_tbl
text: Constructed dataset representing standard deck cards.

what: Speed and Stopping Distances of Cars — cars_df
title: Speed and Stopping Distances of Cars — cars_df
text: `cars_df` dataset contains data speed cars corresponding distances required stop. dataset often used statistical analysis regression modeling. dataset name suffixed `_df` indicate data frame, ensuring clarity within `sampledatasets` package.

title: Speed and Stopping Distances of Cars — cars_df
Speed and Stopping Distances of Cars — cars_df
text: data frame 50 observations 2 variables: speed Speed car (mph) (numeric). dist Stopping distance (ft) (numeric).

title: Speed and Stopping Distances of Cars — cars_df
text: Data 1920s. Originally included *datasets* package R.

what: Motor Trend Car Road Tests — mtcars_df
title: Motor Trend Car Road Tests — mtcars_df
text: `mtcars_df` dataset provides information extracted 1974 Motor Trend US magazine. comprises data fuel consumption 10 aspects automobile design performance 32 cars (1973–74 models). dataset name suffixed `_df` identify data frame, making easier distinguish within `sampledatasets` package.

title: Motor Trend Car Road Tests — mtcars_df
Motor Trend Car Road Tests — mtcars_df
text: data frame 32 observations 11 variables: mpg Miles/(US) gallon (numeric). cyl Number cylinders (numeric). disp Displacement (cu..) (numeric). hp Gross horsepower (numeric). drat Rear axle ratio (numeric). wt Weight (1000 lbs) (numeric). qsec 1/4 mile time (numeric). vs Engine (0 = V-shaped, 1 = straight) (numeric). Transmission (0 = automatic, 1 = manual) (numeric). gear Number forward gears (numeric). carb Number carburetors (numeric).

title: Motor Trend Car Road Tests — mtcars_df
text: Motor Trend, 1974.

what: Swiss Fertility and Socioeconomic Indicators (1888) — swiss_df
title: Swiss Fertility and Socioeconomic Indicators (1888) — swiss_df
text: `swiss_df` dataset provides standardized fertility measures socioeconomic indicators 47 French-speaking provinces Switzerland 1888. dataset name suffixed `_df` indicate data frame, ensuring clarity within `sampledatasets` package.

title: Swiss Fertility and Socioeconomic Indicators (1888) — swiss_df
Swiss Fertility and Socioeconomic Indicators (1888) — swiss_df
text: data frame 47 observations 6 variables: Fertility Standardized fertility measure (numeric). Agriculture Percentage males involved agriculture occupation (numeric). Examination Percentage draftees receiving highest mark army examination (integer). Education Percentage draftees education beyond primary school (integer). Catholic Percentage Catholic individuals (numeric). Infant.Mortality Infant mortality rate per 1000 live births (numeric).

title: Swiss Fertility and Socioeconomic Indicators (1888) — swiss_df
text: Data Swiss Federal Statistical Office (1888).
